analysis.Summary: Vue SFC that provides a two‐column layout for the user account/configurator section, renders page‐specific child components via <router‐view> with a transition, and offers a logout button.
analysis.Purpose: Acts as the main layout wrapper for all '/account/*' routes, handling navigation tabs (currently simplified to a logout action) and rendering nested pages inside a transition.

Components.name: section#account
Components.role: Top‐level container that applies grid layout and padding.

Components.name: div.menu-tabs
Components.role: Holds navigation controls (tabs or buttons) for the account section.

Components.name: button (logout)
Components.role: Triggers the logout flow and redirects to the sign-in page.

Components.name: router‐view + transition + component
Components.role: Renders the currently active child route inside a 'scaleIn' transition.

Functions.name: changeTab
Functions.description: Updates the reactive 'currentTab' state (not currently bound to any UI element).

Functions.name: logout
Functions.description: Calls the auth store's logout action, then navigates to the 'Sign In' route.

analysis.Usage: Imported as the layout component in the router configuration for all '/account' child routes. Wraps child pages and provides a consistent UI shell.
Notes: The <style> block is empty—custom styles likely inherited from global/parent styles or to be added later.
Several role-based tab buttons are commented out, indicating potential admin-only navigation options.
Computed and onMounted are imported but not used; they can be removed unless needed for future logic.
Reactive 'currentTab' state exists but is not currently bound to any visible UI state.
